newsitem.title: USA: Pacific Animated sees Q1 loss of $600,000.
newsitem.headline: Pacific Animated sees Q1 loss of $600,000.

text.p: Pacific Animated Imaging Corp on Tuesday said it expected to report a first-quarter loss of about $600,000, compared with a loss of $804,000 in the year-ago period.
The company said first-quarter revenues would jump 500 percent to about $1.5 million from $247,000.
The multimedia software company also said it became profitable on an operating basis in March for the first time.
"Based on current business trends, management expects increasing revenues in profits in subsequent quarters," said chairman and chief executive, John Cadigan.

Cadigan said the increase in revenues and recent profitability in part reflected the integration of two acquisitions made last year. The purchases of U.S. Technologies and Foresight have started to pay off, he said.

Pacific Animated makes multilingual, interactive, multimedia software for the Internet and internal corporate networks known as intranets. It also provides technical documentation, training, performance support and groupware software integration.
